result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Shepard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A Shepard not in court, in custody. Attorney Samuel J. Sarver in court for Michael A Shepard.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica R. Gereau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Oshkosh CI did not produce the defendant via zoom.  Present bond continued
Plea hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Michael A Shepard appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Samuel J. Sarver in court for Michael A Shepard.  Prosecuting attorney Meranda Hillmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Prosecuting attorney Jessica R. Gereau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael A Shepard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel J. Sarver in court for Michael A Shepard. Oshkosh CI did not produce the defendant.  Present bond continued
Arraignment scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Aaron Linssen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael A Shepard in court via zoom, in custody at Oshkosh Correctional.  Attorney Samuel J. Sarver in court for Michael A Shepard. Attorney Sarver appears with the Defendant. 
Court finds probable cause and orders defendant bound over to the assigned branch. 
Present bond continued
Arraignment scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with MRL
or their residence or place of employment.
